title: Popular sleeping pill linked to reduced Alzheimer's protein buildup, study reveals - The Times of India
summary:
Popular sleeping pill linked to reduced Alzheimer's protein buildup, study reveals

Publication Date: 2023 | Source: Annals of Neurology

A new study suggests that taking sleeping pills may help lower the risk of Alzheimer's disease by reducing the accumulation of key proteins associated with the condition.

  • Researchers found that those who took suvorexant, a common insomnia medication, for two nights showed a reduction in amyloid-beta and tau proteins.
  • The study involved 38 middle-aged participants who were monitored for protein levels while accounting for sleep quality.
  • Results indicated a 10-20% decrease in amyloid-beta levels for those on the medication compared to the placebo group.
  • There are concerns about the indiscriminate use of sleep medications without further research.
“If you can reduce tau phosphorylation, potentially there would be less tangle formation and less neuronal death,” said neurologist Brendan Lucey.

This research highlights the potential link between sleep quality and the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, suggesting that improving sleep might be beneficial.
newTitle: Study Reveals Popular Sleeping Pill May Reduce Alzheimer's Protein Buildup

title: 4th Test, Day 2: Steve Smith Century, Yashasvi Jaiswal Run Out Deflate India At MCG - News18
summary:
4th Test, Day 2: Steve Smith Century, Yashasvi Jaiswal Run Out Deflate India At MCG

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: News18

A crucial moment unfolded when Yashasvi Jaiswal’s run-out sparked a collapse for India, who ended day two of the fourth Test against Australia at 164/5, chasing a first innings score of 474.

  • Jaiswal scored 82 runs from 118 balls before his run-out, which triggered a poor performance from Indian batsmen.
  • Steve Smith scored his 34th Test century, contributing significantly to Australia's score.
  • India needs 111 more runs to avoid a follow-on, struggling at 310 runs behind.
  • Jaiswal and Kohli's partnership yielded 102 runs before the unfortunate dismissal.
“This moment will be one for posterity as Kohli looked down and perhaps felt that he could have at least said a loud ‘No’.”

The day concluded with Australia firmly in control, leaving India with a challenging path ahead in the Test match.
newTitle: Steve Smith Century and Jaiswal's Run-Out Dim India's Hopes at MCG

title: Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates - News18
summary:
Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: News

Delhi experienced heavy rainfall and lightning today as the cold wave intensified. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted thunderstorms, hailstorms, and moderate rainfall across northwestern and central India on December 27 and 28 due to an active western disturbance.

  • Temperature in Delhi stood at 13 degree Celsius at 7:23am.
  • The maximum temperature expected to reach 20 degrees Celsius, with a minimum of 12 degrees Celsius.
  • Heavy rain and strong winds forecasted for December 27th and 28th.
  • IMD issued warnings for hailstorms in several northern states.
  • Delhi’s air quality remains ‘very poor’, with some improvement expected.
“On December 27 and 28, Madhya Pradesh is likely to face similar conditions.”

The weather department's warnings indicate serious impacts on daily life in Delhi and surrounding areas, highlighting the need for precautionary measures.
newTitle: Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates

title: On Virat Kohli-Sam Konstas Clash, BCCI President Roger Binny Makes Feelings Clear: "You Have To..." - NDTV Sports
summary:
BCCI President Roger Binny Comments on Kohli-Konstas On-Field Clash

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas had a noticeable altercation during the first day of the fourth Test at the MCG, with BCCI's Roger Binny commenting on the incident.

  • Roger Binny addressed the on-field clash between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas, emphasizing that such incidents are part of cricket.
  • Kohli was fined 20% of his match fee and received a demerit point for the altercation.
  • Konstas downplayed the incident, stating it was an accidental bump while he was adjusting his gloves.
  • Binny praised India's performance in the final session, highlighting their four wickets and expressing confidence in the batters.
“I did not see the incident, but these things happen on the cricket ground. You have to accept it and carry on.” - Roger Binny

In conclusion, the clash highlighted the competitive nature of cricket, but both players and officials agreed that it's part of the game.
newTitle: BCCI President Roger Binny Comments on Kohli-Konstas On-Field Clash

title: "External Interference" Caused Plane Crash In Kazakhstan: Azerbaijan Airlines - NDTV
summary:
Kazakhstan Plane Crash Linked to External Interference, Says Azerbaijan Airlines

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Azerbaijan Airlines stated that "external physical and technical interference" was responsible for a tragic plane crash in Kazakhstan that resulted in 38 fatalities out of 67 passengers.

  • The Embraer 190 aircraft diverted and crashed in Aktau, Kazakhstan, after being denied landing in Grozny due to fog.
  • There are reports suggesting a possible accidental missile strike from Russian air defenses.
  • An investigation is ongoing, with evidence of missile damage noted by experts.
  • A passenger reported a loud bang before the aircraft began to behave erratically.
  • Azerbaijan Airlines announced the suspension of flights to multiple Russian airports for safety reasons.
“I thought the plane was going to fall apart,” - Subhonkul Rakhimov, passenger.

The situation around the crash emphasizes the ongoing tensions involving air travel and defense systems in politically sensitive regions.
newTitle: Kazakhstan Plane Crash Linked to External Interference, Says Azerbaijan Airlines

title: NASA's Parker solar probe is 'safe' after historic closest approach to Sun - Business Standard
summary:
NASA's Parker solar probe is 'safe' after historic closest approach to Sun

Publication Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe has made history by becoming the first man-made object to complete a closest-ever approach to the Sun, and it's reported to be safe and operational.

  • The probe came within 3.8 million miles of the Sun's surface on December 24, 2023.
  • It transmitted a beacon tone indicating good health after the record-breaking approach.
  • The mission aims to uncover secrets about solar heat and solar wind.
  • The spacecraft is traveling at a speed of 430,000 mph and withstood temperatures up to 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
  • It has completed 21 passes of the Sun since its launch in 2018.
“This close-up study of the Sun allows Parker Solar Probe to take measurements that help scientists better understand how material in this region gets heated to millions of degrees...” - NASA

The detailed telemetry data on the probe's condition is expected on January 1, 2024.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Approach to the Sun

title: Bird flu virus shows mutations in first severe human case in U.S., CDC says - The Hindu
summary:
Mutation Detected in First Severe U.S. Bird Flu Case, CDC Reports

Date: December 27, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The CDC announced mutations in the hemagglutinin gene in the first severe bird flu case in the U.S., detected in a Louisiana resident. The outbreak remains low risk for the general public.

  • First severe bird flu case reported in the U.S. occurred in Louisiana.
  • The patient is over 65 years old and has severe respiratory illness.
  • Infection caused by D1.1 genotype, not the B3.13 genotype.
  • Mutations are rare but have been reported in severe infections in other countries.
  • No person-to-person transmission identified from this case.
The risk to the general public from the outbreak has not changed and remains low.

This finding highlights the necessity of monitoring mutations in the bird flu virus and underscores the current low risk to public health.
newTitle: Mutation Detected in First Severe U.S. Bird Flu Case, CDC Reports

title: FBI ‘Found Covid Was Leaked From China Lab’ But Joe Biden Was Kept In Dark: Report - News18
summary:
FBI ‘Found Covid Was Leaked From China Lab’ But Joe Biden Was Kept In Dark: Report

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: News18

The FBI reportedly silenced evidence supporting the theory that Covid-19 leaked from a Chinese lab, findings which were excluded from a report presented to President Biden.

  • The FBI suppressed information from US defense and research institutions regarding the lab leak theory.
  • Key findings were omitted from an August 2021 report which contradicted the theory.
  • Research indicated that spike proteins aiding human transmission were consistent with prior studies from the Wuhan Institute of Virology.
  • Intelligence officials prevented researchers from discussing their analysis with Congress and the FBI.
  • A whistleblower revealed improper classification of federal grant documents related to viral engineering.
  • Chinese authorities maintain that the virus likely originated from bats, not a lab leak.
“The scientists with subject matter expertise were silenced.”

The event raises significant questions regarding transparency and the origins of the Covid-19 pandemic, indicating potential implications for future public health policies and international relations.
newTitle: FBI Report Indicates Covid-19 May Have Originated from Chinese Lab, Biden Uninformed

title: Current account deficit narrows to $11.2 billion in Q2FY25 - The Economic Times
summary:
Current account deficit at $11.2 billion in July-September

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

The current account deficit for the July-September quarter stood at $11.2 billion, representing 1.2% of GDP, slightly lower than the revised figure of $11.3 billion for the same period last year.

  • The deficit was $9.7 billion, or 1.1% of GDP, in the preceding quarter.
  • The figures are reported by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).
“The current account deficit was $11.2 billion in the reporting quarter.”

This slight reduction in the deficit indicates a marginal improvement in the balance of payments situation.
newTitle: Current Account Deficit Reaches $11.2 Billion in Q2

title: Akin To B-21 Raider’s Broad-Spectrum Stealth, China’s New 6th-Gen Stealth Fighters Bound To Rattle U.S. Military - EurAsian Times
summary:
China Unveils New 6th-Generation Stealth Fighters

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

China has recently unveiled two new stealth fighter prototypes, featuring broad-spectrum stealth technology that enhances their ability to evade radar detection across various frequencies.

  • Broad-spectrum stealth minimizes detectability to both high and low-frequency radars.
  • This technology was previously seen only in strategic bombers, marking a significant leap for fighter jets.
  • The introduction of these fighters positions China ahead in global stealth capabilities.
  • The larger fighter, possibly the J-36, has enhanced payload capacity and stealth features.
  • The smaller fighter, likely from SAC, is designed for agility and air superiority roles.
  • Capabilities of the new fighters may include optional manning and next-generation power plants.
“China’s rapid advancement in military aviation technology is unquestionable.”

The prototypes reveal China's significant progress in military technology but actual capabilities will be assessed as they develop further.
newTitle: China Unveils New 6th-Generation Stealth Fighters, Advancing Military Aviation Technology

title: Lazavik Beats Carlsen; Murzin, Sargsyan, Dominguez, Naroditsky Lead Open - Chess.com
summary:
Lazavik Beats Carlsen; Murzin, Sargsyan, Dominguez, Naroditsky Lead Open

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Chess.com

The 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship is underway, showcasing fierce competition among top chess players, including an upset where GM Denis Lazavik defeated Magnus Carlsen. After five rounds, GMs Volodar Murzin, Shant Sargsyan, Leinier Dominguez, and Daniel Naroditsky lead the Open section.

  • Denis Lazavik defeats Magnus Carlsen, who is struggling with a score of 2.5/5.
  • Alice Lee leads the Women's championship with a perfect score of 4/4.
  • Strong performances by local players like Brewington Hardaway and Tani Adewumi.
  • The championship takes place in New York City, a historic first for FIDE's rapid tournaments.

If he makes this comeback back into the event, we'll all be shocked.
—Aman Hambleton on Magnus Carlsen

The tournament has drawn significant attention as players compete not only for a shared prize fund of $1.5 million but also for ranking points in the FIDE Circuit, leading to the 2026 Candidates Tournament.
newTitle: Lazavik Upsets Carlsen; Murzin, Sargsyan, Dominguez, Naroditsky Lead Rapid Championship

title: Manmohan Singh Death News Updates: ‘A setback for the whole nation,’ says PM Modi, calls former PM an ‘inspiration for coming generations’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Manmohan Singh Death News Updates

Date: December 2024, Source: Indian Express

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, a pivotal figure in India's economic reforms, has passed away at the age of 92. His death marks a significant loss for the nation, with senior leaders paying tribute at his residence in Delhi.

  • Manmohan Singh passed away on Thursday evening in Delhi.
  • He served two terms as Prime Minister, with a notable economic reform legacy from 1991.
  • His last rites will be performed near Rajghat following tributes at AICC headquarters.
“A setback for the whole nation,” said PM Modi, calling him an “inspiration for coming generations.”

This loss is felt across the nation, as Singh is remembered for his contributions to India's economic policies and governance.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh Passes Away, Remembered as an Inspiration

title: Ajit Agarkar To Speak To Rohit Sharma On Test Future, India Captain Might Retire If...: Report - Times Now
summary:
Ajit Agarkar To Speak To Rohit Sharma On Test Future, India Captain Might Retire If...: Report

Date & Source: No specific date provided, Source: PTI

As India plays against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, concerns are growing regarding Rohit Sharma's future in Test cricket after a string of poor performances.

  • Rohit Sharma has scored just 19 runs in the series and 155 runs in 8 Tests at an average of 11.07.
  • Ajit Agarkar, the chairman of selectors, is expected to have a conversation with Rohit about his future in Test matches.
  • If India does not qualify for the World Test Championship 2025 final, the fifth Test may mark Rohit's last appearance in red-ball cricket.
  • Rohit felt uncomfortable batting in the middle order, leading to Shubman Gill's exclusion from the playing XI.
  • Rohit replaced KL Rahul in the opening spot, but was dismissed for just 5 runs in the match.
“His stay lasted only five balls, as he top-edged a short ball from Pat Cummins.”

The future of Rohit Sharma in Test cricket hangs in the balance as selectors assess performance ahead of key tournaments.
newTitle: Ajit Agarkar To Discuss Test Future With Rohit Sharma Amid Speculations Of Retirement

title: Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor - Upstox
summary:
Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

The 2023-24 Consumption Expenditure Survey reveals a narrowing urban-rural gap in consumption expenditure, with non-food items dominating household spending.

  • The urban-rural gap in monthly per capita consumption expenditure (MPCE) decreased to 70% in 2023-24.
  • Average MPCE was ₹4,122 in rural and ₹6,996 in urban areas, rising to ₹4,247 and ₹7,078 when including government welfare benefits.
  • Sikkim had the highest MPCE, while Chhattisgarh recorded the lowest.
  • Non-food items account for 53% of rural and 60% of urban household expenditures.
  • The Gini coefficient for inequality declined in both rural (0.237) and urban (0.284) areas.
  • Rent constitutes around 7% of urban non-food expenditure.
“Rent with a share of around 7% is another major constituent of households’ non-food expenditure in urban India.”

Overall, the survey highlights significant trends in consumption patterns and a decrease in inequality, impacting economic indicators such as GDP and CPI.
newTitle: Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor

Ark's Cathie Wood calls for tax clarity as she rides 'Trump bump' | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Cathie Wood Urges Tax Clarity from Trump's Administration

Publication Date: Dec 27
Source: Reuters

Cathie Wood, a prominent U.S. tech investor, is advocating for clarity on tax policies from Donald Trump's incoming administration. She believes backdating tax cuts to January 1, 2025, would stimulate economic growth.

  • Wood's ARK Innovation ETF has surged 17% post-Trump's victory, outperforming the S&P500.
  • Key holdings Tesla and Coinbase have seen significant increases in their stock prices since November.
  • Wood supports Trump's economic platform, advocating for reduced tariffs and tax cuts.
  • Analysts expect a push for tax reform by the new Congress, with Trump poised to use executive orders to implement policies.
  • Wood has not financially supported Trump but maintains contact with key figures like Elon Musk and Senator Cynthia Lummis.
“I see them saying, okay, we're going to cut taxes but we will make them retroactive to Jan. 1, 2025. That would be very helpful, I think, in terms of providing certainty for the markets.” - Cathie Wood

Wood believes that while the market's initial excitement may fade, innovation-driven sectors will benefit in the long run.
newTitle: Cathie Wood Urges Tax Clarity from Trump's Administration

title: Diabetes in cats, dogs: symptoms, treatment, and how to ensure they remain healthy - India.com
summary:
Diabetes in cats, dogs: symptoms, treatment, and how to ensure they remain healthy

Publication Date: N/A
Source: India.com

Diabetes isn’t just a human concern—it also affects our beloved pets. Dogs and cats can develop diabetes mellitus, a condition that affects how their body processes glucose. With proper care, monitoring, and early intervention, pets with diabetes can still live happy and fulfilling lives.

Key Points:

  • Diabetes in pets can manifest as excessive thirst, frequent urination, increased appetite, and weight loss.
  • Types of diabetes include Type 1 (common in dogs) and Type 2 (more common in cats).
  • Early diagnosis through blood tests and urine analysis is key to effective management.
  • Treatment involves insulin therapy, dietary changes, and regular exercise.
  • Pet owners play a crucial role in monitoring and managing their pets' diabetes.
"With the right support, diabetes doesn’t have to be a barrier to a fulfilling life for dogs and cats."

While diabetes in pets is a serious condition, it is manageable with proper care, medication, and lifestyle changes.
newTitle: Understanding Diabetes in Cats and Dogs: Symptoms, Treatment, and Care Tips

title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection week 3 wrap up: The Allu Arjun starrer collects Rs 129 crore in third we - TOI Etimes
summary:
'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Week 3 Wrap Up

Published on: Not specified Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2: The Rule' has made history by surpassing the previous box office record held by 'Baahubali 2'. In its third week alone, the film collected an impressive ₹ 129.5 crore, bringing the total gross to ₹ 1122.54 crore.

  • The film has broken records previously held by 'Stree 2', 'Jawan', and 'Gadar 2'.
  • In its third week, approximately ₹ 103.05 crore of the total collection came from the Hindi version.
  • Despite a 50% drop from the previous week's collection of ₹ 264 crore, it achieved significant milestones.
  • The movie's total net collection in India as of now is ₹ 1122.54 crore.
  • 'Pushpa 2' remains unaffected by the release of Varun Dhawan's 'Baby John' on Christmas.
"To cross ₹ 100 crore in its third week is not a small feat for a movie."

In conclusion, 'Pushpa 2' has not only set a new benchmark for box office collections in Indian cinema but also demonstrated exceptional staying power in its third week.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Box Office Breaks Records with Rs 1122.54 Crore Total Collection

title: German President dissolves parliament, calls early election for February 23 - The Times of India
summary:
German President dissolves parliament, calls early election for February 23

Date: October 10, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The German President has officially dissolved the current parliament, announcing early elections to be held on February 23. This decision comes in light of significant political shifts and demands from various factions within the government.

  • Early elections are set for February 23, 2024.
  • The decision was prompted by recent political instability and mounting pressure for reforms.
  • Key political figures support the move, citing the need for a renewed mandate from the electorate.
  • Opposition parties are preparing their campaigns, while ruling party factions are in a state of reorganization.
"This is a necessary step to restore trust in our democracy," the President stated during the announcement.

This dissolution marks a crucial turning point in German politics, as voters will now have the opportunity to express their views on the current governance and direction of the country.
newTitle: German President Calls Early Election for Parliament

Woman dies days after hospital gives her overdoses of paracetamol: Report - The Times of India
summary:
Woman dies days after hospital gives her overdoses of paracetamol: Report

Date: April 19, 2017 Source: The Liverpool Echo

In an unfortunate incident, a mom of two, named Laura Higginson, died days after being administered staggered overdoses of paracetamol. She was admitted to the hospital with suspected pneumonia and received excessive doses before the medical team recognized their error.

  • Laura Higginson was a 30-year-old woman weighing less than 40 kilos.
  • She was given inappropriate doses of paracetamol over several days.
  • Her health deteriorated leading to her death on April 19 due to multi-organ failure.
  • The hospital admitted to the dosing error but claimed the antidote prevented fatal consequences.
  • The issue is currently under legal scrutiny, being subjudice.
“While paracetamol is generally safe when used correctly, overdosing can lead to serious health issues, including liver failure.”

This tragic case stresses the importance of careful medication management and monitoring in healthcare settings.
newTitle: Woman dies after hospital's paracetamol overdose

title: Virat Kohli receives on-air apology from ex-Australian cricketer after 'built his entire career on arroga - The Times of India
summary:
Virat Kohli Receives On-Air Apology from Ex-Australian Cricketer

Publication Date: Recent Source: Times of India

Former Australian cricketer Kerry O'Keeffe has apologized for his comments about Virat Kohli, which he made during a live broadcast after a confrontation during the fourth Test match at the MCG.

  • Kerry O'Keeffe criticized Virat Kohli, claiming he built his career on arrogance.
  • The comments came after a heated exchange between Kohli and debutant Sam Konstas.
  • O'Keeffe faced backlash from fans and pundits for his remarks.
  • In his apology, he clarified that Kohli's competitive nature should not be labeled as arrogance.
  • Kohli was fined 20% of his match fee and received a demerit point for inappropriate contact with Konstas.
Kerry O'Keeffe: 'I want to apologise for calling Virat Kohli's behaviour arrogance... Kohli is a passionate cricketer and his aggression is what makes him a competitive cricketer.'

This incident highlights the intensity of cricket matches and the scrutiny players face, especially during high-pressure situations.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Receives On-Air Apology from Ex-Australian Cricketer

Sikandar’s teaser delay: The UNTOLD story on how Salman Khan and Sajid Nadiadwala prioritized respect over celebration on his birthday amid national mourning - Bollywood Hungama
summary:
Salman Khan Delays Sikandar Teaser Out of Respect Amid National Mourning

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Bollywood Hungama

On December 26, Salman Khan announced the teaser release of his upcoming film Sikandar, coinciding with his birthday. However, following the passing of ex-Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, the teaser was postponed to show respect. While fans expressed disappointment, industry insiders praised the decision.

  • The teaser for Sikandar was originally set to release on December 27, coinciding with Salman Khan’s birthday.
  • Following the death of Manmohan Singh, the teaser release was postponed by 24 hours.
  • Industry insiders commend Salman Khan and producer Sajid Nadiadwala for prioritizing respect over celebration.
  • The film, directed by A R Murugadoss, is set to release on Eid 2025.
“It wouldn’t be right to bring the teaser at a time when the country is mourning.” - Insider on Khan's decision

This decision highlights the importance of empathy in the entertainment industry, balancing fan expectations with societal respect.
newTitle: Salman Khan Delays Sikandar Teaser Out of Respect Amid National Mourning

Osamu Suzuki, who led Japanese automaker into India, dies at 94 - The Hindu
summary:
Osamu Suzuki, Pioneer of Suzuki Motor and Indian Auto Market, Dies at 94

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: [Source Name]

Osamu Suzuki, a legendary figure in the automotive industry and former chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation, passed away at the age of 94 on Christmas Day due to lymphoma. He was instrumental in transforming the Indian auto market and expanding Suzuki's global reach.

  • Suzuki led Suzuki Motor for over 40 years, significantly impacting the automotive landscape.
  • He focused on cost efficiency, which shaped the company's operations, including lowering factory ceilings for savings.
  • Under his leadership, Suzuki launched the Maruti 800, revolutionizing the Indian car market.
  • Suzuki played a key role in establishing a partnership with Maruti at a time when India had limited car production.
  • His quirky personality and humor were noted, often playfully stating he would stay with the company 'forever.'
  • The company he built retains about 40% of the Indian car market today.
“To be number one somewhere in the world” was his motivation for investing in India.

Osamu Suzuki’s legacy will continue through the ongoing success of Maruti Suzuki, marking a significant chapter in automotive history.
newTitle: Osamu Suzuki, Pioneer of Suzuki Motor and Indian Auto Market, Dies at 94
